page.title: 04The PLOUGH Public House
page.content: The{"Plough"}is situated in Ripple and the Landlord,{Robert Blanchard,}has owned the pub for seven months. Before this he ran an hotel. Only about a dozen of the local customers come from the village. There is a small patio and garden for children. Mr Blanchard employs a cook and the family also help prepare the food. He employs six bar staff, all women. The opening hours are from 11am to 2.30pm and from 6pm to 11pm on Mondays to Saturdays and on Sundays from 12pm to 2pm and 7pm to 10.3pm. The pub specialises in different types of "real ales" which are changed regularly. The Landlord says that his most popular drinks are "real ales" and German wine.
